sentences.en: A nautical almanac gives information about the sun, moon, tides, etc.

sentences.en: Admiral Aikton's nautical charts indicated the Islands belonged to Rydal.
sentences.cn: 将军乔治·埃克顿的航海图指出这些群岛是属于赖德尔王国的.

sentences.en: Have the nautical chart at your fingertips, and you'll be able to steer your ship.
It is 206 nautical miles from our present location.
sentences.cn: 距离我们现在的位置有206海里.

sentences.en: It is a nautical term, I suppose.
Nautical An enclosure in a ship's hold for the pumps.
sentences.cn: [航海]底舱水泵间:在船舱内装有水泵的小房间.

sentences.cn: 离开, 如口岸或港口; 出发.

sentences.en: The breadth of the contiguous zone is twelve nautical miles.
sentences.cn: 毗连区的宽度为十二海里.

sentences.en: The distance covered was to be 1500 nautical miles.
sentences.cn: 覆盖的距离达到了1500海里.

sentences.en: The ship was 200 international nautical miles off course.
sentences.cn: 那船偏离航向200国际海里.

sentences.en: This measures how much it costs to move a ton - one nautical mile.
sentences.cn: 这项措施需要多少成本动议一吨 - 一海里.
